p: At T0, the two groups showed no significant differences in mean of FMPS values, full-mouth PD and CAL. At T1, the TG group showed a significant decrease in FMPS ( p = 0.005) compared with the CG group. Moreover, there were no significant differences in mean of full-mouth PD and CAL between the two groups at T1: both groups showed a significant reduction in PD ( p = 0.001 TG; p = 0.011 CG) and CAL ( p < 0.001 TG; p = 0.020 CG) values from baseline to 3 months ( Table 2). There were no subjective complaints, adverse outcomes or side effects reported or observed in both groups at day 20, 40, 60, 80 and 3 months ( Table 3).
